Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2012 06:11PM anastasia31 wrote: Hi Curveball, perfect moniker, by the way!  I called the hospital and I won't get the pathology report back til my follow up visit two weeks after surgery.  Seems like a long time, but what can you do?  I guess they don't like to tell you the results over the phone.  I don't have a good feeling about the results anyway since in addition to the lump which I'm sure they were able to remove successfully, I have scattered DCIS.  But I will just have to wait and see.  Best of luck to you too in your treatments and recovery!
Posts.Title: Sentinel Node Surprises curveball anastasia31

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2012 11:15PM anastasia31 wrote: Hi Curveball, My injection was right at the outside edge of the aereola.  It was excrutiating pain.  I was under the impression they inject it with an anesthetic i.e., lidocaine, but no such luck.  Did you get an anesthetic with your injection?  Anyway, the sentinal nodes were about where they expected them to be, in my armpit so no suprises there.  I guess I am pretty lucky as everything seems to be healing ok.  No sutures or steri-strips at all, just surgical glue.  How about you?  Now its just the waiting game for the pathology report.  Hope your recovery is going well.
